adjective.description: As great, high, or intense as possible or permitted.
examples: a maximum penalty of ten years' imprisonment

noun.description: The greatest or highest amount possible or attained.
examples: the school takes a maximum of 32 students
production levels are near their maximum
it has a length of 4 feet maximum

origin: Mid 17th century (as a noun): from modern Latin, neuter (used as a noun) of the Latin adjective maximus, superlative of magnus great. The adjectival use dates from the early 19th century.
